place.name: BETWS GWERFUL GOCH
place.gazetteerText: BETTWS-GWERFIL-GOCH, a hamlet and a parish in Corwen district, Merioneth. The hamlet stands near the river Alwen, 4 miles NW of Corwen r. station; and has a post office under Corwen. The parish comprises 2,650 acres. Real property, £695. Pop., 242. Houses, 59. The property is divided among a few. The living is a rectory in the diocese of St. Asaph. Value, £124. Patron, the Bishop of St. Asaph. The church is early English, and tolerable. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
